member_organisations:
Bioversity International is a member of the CGIAR Consortium - a global partnership for a food-secure future funded by CGIAR Fund Donors. Within CGIAR, we work on 9 cross-cutting global research programmes including climate change, nutrition and forests./ 
We also work in close partnership with the United Nations Rome-based organizations: Food and Agriculture Organization of the UN (FAO), International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) and the World Food Programme. 
For more information: https://www.bioversityinternational.org/partners/research-partners/
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, International co-operation and development, Environment, Research and innovation, Food Safety, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Participating to the Hearing at the European Parliament's Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development (AGRI)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Bioversity International is a global research-for-development organization. We have a vision – that agricultural biodiversity nourishes people and sustains the planet.  
 
We deliver scientific evidence, management practices and policy options to use and safeguard agricultural biodiversity to attain sustainable global food and nutrition security. We work with partners in low-income countries in different regions where agricultural biodiversity can contribute to improved nutrition, resilience, productivity and climate change adaptation.  
 
Bioversity International is a member of the CGIAR Consortium – a global research partnership for a food secure future
